name: 826 Equine Studbooks Association
goal: The 826 Equine Studbooks Association represents the equine studbook passport issuing organisations in the UK currently recognised by DEFRA. Its primary role is to scrutinise all proposed and current EU regulations and UK laws, regulations and Codes of Practice relating to equidae that affects the equestrian industry in the UK, Europe and the wider world. It also has a watching brief on equine welfare matters as they relate to the equestrian breeding and production industry.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Sport, Trade
euInitiatives: All EU initiatives, policies and legislative files relating to any part of the equestrian industry, particularly those relating to equine passports, zootechnics, the Animal Health Law and the Tripartite Agreement.
